page.title: 06Strathmiglo Primary School
page.content: Strathmiglo Primary School was built over a hundred years ago.It has twice been renovated since, the last time in 1961.Despite its age the building is in very good condition.Heating for the school is provided by a coal-fired boiler.Sometimes,during the winter,the system breaks down and children have to be sent home.At the moment, the school role is 72.There are 4 classes and 4teachers.The Headteacher takes primary 7. Specialists visit the school to teach art,P.E.,music and drama.Activities after school include country dancing,creative dancing, computer club,recorder and football. At the end of primary 7 children transfer to High School.The nearest High School is Bell-Baxter in Cupar and most choose to go there. Transport is provided and the journey,by bus, takes 25 minutes.
